item.title: Senior Governance Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The current assignment will evaluate al components of the RPC programme, from the start of actual implementation to the present date. The evaluation will pay particular attention to the balance between programme components and the overall expected results foreseen in the initial programme design. In this context, the MTR team is requested to make an objective assessment of the relevance and quality of the project design; in addition, the team is expected to evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of the proposed activities and interventions towards meeting the stated objectives and expected results.

Project Location: Gaborone and field missions (interviews with different RPC stakeholders) & selected SADC Member States

Senior Governance Expert

  • A Master’s degree in Political Science, Social Science, International relations or related political and social science Field (or at least 10 years of professional experience in governance, peace and security cooperation in addition to the experience requested below);
  • At least 10 years professional experience in the area of Governance and Human Rights;
  • A minimum of 5 years working experience in Sub Saharan Africa (preferably within the SADC region);
  • Proven working experience on conflict prevention and/or conflict management (incl. for example mediation, conflict resolution mechanisms);
  • Proven working experience on crisis management (e.g. disaster risk reduction, humanitarian assistance);

item.title: Agricultural Technical Assistance Advisors
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall goal of this activity is to reduce the burden of childhood malnutrition through the production, promotion and uptake of nutritious, locally-produced complementary foods for children of 6-23 months, and nutritional supplements for pregnant and lactating women (PLW). The activity is implemented by Clinton Health Access Initiative (CHAI) who work closely with local governments, international investors and donors. The activity is initially being implemented in Rwanda and Ethiopia and will potentially be expanded to two further African countries. MFAT are contributing to component three of the activity which aims to ensure a reliable supply of local crop inputs for the factory that will produce the complementary foods. To achieve this, CHAI are working with smallholder farmers, cooperatives and unions to increase the quantity and quality of maize and soya produced. These services will supply technical assistance to CHAI, local trainers and government extension providers to strengthen farmer training programmes and provide technical information to farmers unions and cooperatives to inform investments in harvest and post-harvest technology.

The outcomes of these services will be:

  1. Extension service providers can sustainably deliver practical and effective farmer-oriented training to increase the quantity and quality of soya and maize yields.
  2. Farmers cooperatives and unions are able to make informed decisions about the costs and benefits of investing in agricultural technology to assist with planting, harvest and post-harvest. It is expected that the team of consultants will demonstrate the following expertise and experience:

Agricultural expertise and experience

  • Horticultural production in Africa or a developing country setting
  • Post-harvest handling
  • Soya and Maize productivity

  • Farm mechanization

  • Technical capacity building for farm extension workers

  • Train the trainer models

  • Adult learning techniques an advantage

  • Curriculum development an advantage

Development expertise and experience

  • Strong relationship building, communication skills, capacity development skills and ability to successfully facilitate training workshops using participatory approaches; and
  • Commitment to highlight human rights, gender and environmental issues in the activity

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFID/EC format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to (http://Europehr@dai.com) quoting MFAT Agriculture Panel in the subject line of your email. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Expert 4: Spécialiste en analyse des politiques économiques et des programmes
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Objectif global L’objectif est d’élaborer une Stratégie Nationale des Exportations.

Objectifs spécifiques: De manière spécifique, il s’agira de :

  • Faire un état des lieux et un diagnostic du système et du processus des exportations au Cameroun intégrant notamment les aspects institutionnels, réglementaires, statistiques et des performances commerciales;
  • Analyser les grandes orientations de la politique commerciale, la pratique et les accords commerciaux existants et les opportunités existantes au niveau international et régional en relation avec la promotion des exportations. Cette analyse permettra notamment de prendre en compte la consolidation ainsi que la diversification des partenaires commerciaux;
  • Proposer des choix stratégiques de promotion des exportations du Cameroun intégrant notamment la diversification et la valorisation des produits exportés ainsi que les partenaires commerciaux. On pourra s’appuyer sur un pays, ayant diversifié et augmenté significativement ses exportations, comme modèle en matière d’évolution et même dans le rythme de ses statistiques concernées. Ces choix stratégiques permettront aussi de répondre aux questions « qu’est-ce qu’on doit exporter ? », « où exporter ? » et « comment exporter, sur quelle forme ? »;
  • Elaborer un Plan d’actions Prioritaire chiffrés intégrant les indicateurs objectivement vérifiables ;
  • Proposer un mécanisme de mise en œuvre des différentes actions de la Stratégie Nationale des Exportations du Cameroun. Cette proposition permettra de définir entre autres le type de cohabitation existerait entre les autres outils créés à recenser et l’Agence Nationale des Promotion des Exportations si elle est effective ;
  • Définir un mécanisme de suivi/évaluation de la mise en œuvre de ladite Stratégie Nationale des Exportations.

Qualifications et compétences requises

  • Formation de type universitaire (de niveau minimum BAC + 5) (critère minimal)
  • Bonne connaissance des programmes de coopération de préférence au Cameroun (5 points)
  • Excellente capacité d’analyse et de synthèse (critère minimal)
  • Français: excellent (écrit et parlé); et Anglais: bonnes connaissances (écrit et parlé) (critère minimal)
  • Connaissances en informatique (MS Word, MS Excel, Internet) (critère minimal)

Expérience professionnelle requise

  • Expérience professionnelle d'au moins six (06) ans dans son domaine d’intervention en Afrique centrale et de préférence au Cameroun (critère minimal)
  • Expérience en en organisation des institutions d’appui au secteur privé notamment les organismes de promotion des échanges des produits manufacturiers (10 points)
  • Expérience pratique en études de diagnostic/secteur financés par le FED (5 points)

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to (http://agnese_ortolani@dai.com)

item.description:
Global Objective:

  • To improve the quality and effectiveness of Ukrainian public administration, as well as its capacity to implement the EU-Ukraine association agreement.

Specific objectives:

  • Assist the Government of Ukraine in designing and implementing reform of civil service and administrative legal framework.
  • To ensure alignment of Ukraine’s approaches to modernisation of civil service and administrative legal framework with European principles of public administration and best practices of the EU Member States.

Expert on Administrative legal framework and e-governance

  • Master’s degree in a field relevant to the assignment or 7 years equivalent experience in the sector
  • Fluency in English
  • Good command of Ukrainian or Russian (not essential but highly desirable)

  • A minimum of 12 years experience in civil service or public sector

  • At least 8 years of specific and practical experience in reform of administrative legal framework (administrative procedures, improvement of public services and introduction of e-governance approaches.) * As part of the 8 years required above, at least 3 years of experience at senior level in EU MS administration or in the administration of an accession country in reform of administrative legal framework

Other abilities/experiences to be demonstrated:
